title: Mechanical Engineering Vocational Experience Learning: Practice-Centered Online Short-Term Course

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Asynchronous classes operated on smartphone-based LMS platforms, where learners connect theory with practice by analyzing mechanical systems encountered in daily life

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of mechanical systems by connecting them to three real-world examples (e.g., bicycle gears, automatic door mechanisms).

Learners must complete and submit a worksheet utilizing Kolb’s Experiential Learning Model (Concrete Experience–Reflective Observation–Conceptualization–Active Experimentation) with at least 80% accuracy.
Learners collaboratively propose and exchange feedback on mechanical design problem-solving strategies with peers in online discussion forums at least twice.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
